intro: Trigonotis muliensis, commonly known as the Yunnan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and has lanceolate leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
